page.title: 12Scaleby Buildings
page.content: {Building materials.}Older houses are made mainly of local stone or hand made bricks with slated roofs. Some now have rendered walls. {Post Office.}This is one room set aside for the purpose in a modern bungalow at Barclose. {The Heilk Moon}is the unusual name of the public house at Barclose. It means 'full moon'. {War Memorial.}This is outside the Parish Hall. It is made of Aberdeen granite and is unusual because it lists both the dead and survivors of the First World War. {Church Hall.}This small stone building was put up in 1895 and paid for entirely by R.A.Allison Esq. M.P.
